etymology.description: 戶(戶) (hù, "door") + 方(方) (fāng, "side") = door on the side -> room
etymology.interpretation: 房(fáng, "house; room") combines the semantic element 戶(戶) (hù, "door") with the phonetic element 方(方) (fāng, "side"), suggesting a space associated with a door, like a side room in a house.

examples.chinese: 他在城里租了一间房(他在城裡租了一間房)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài chénglǐ zū le yī jiān fáng.
examples.english: He rented a room in the city.

examples.chinese: 我的房子很温暖(我的房子很溫暖)。
夏天时房间有空调(夏天時房間有空調)，感觉十分舒适(感覺十分舒適)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān shí fángjiān yǒu kōngtiáo, gǎnjué shífēn shūshì.
examples.english: In summer, the room has air conditioning and feels very comfortable.
